Urszula Czerwinska

Deep Learning engineer, Data Scientist, PhD

urszula.czerwinska@cri-paris.org | urszulaczerwinska | ulalaparis | Urszula Czerwinska | UlaLaParis


Download CV


Short Bio

Born in Poland and educated across France and Singapore, I now call Paris home. My journey in bio-mathematics, culminating in a Ph.D., has equipped me with a deep expertise in complex systems, statistics, and programming, especially in Python and R. These diverse experiences have honed my ability to thrive in interdisciplinary settings, bridging the gap between theory and application.

Currently, I’m a Deep Learning Engineer - Data Scientist at Adevinta, where my focus is on pioneering advancements in computer vision and multimodal AI models. I lead the strategic development of foundational models that drive product innovation and enhance e-commerce solutions. My role involves pushing the envelope with PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Kubernetes, and leading our team to achieve impressive results. For instance, I’ve improved scene-text extraction capabilities by 33% and optimized multi-class classification models to boost accuracy by 45%.

My leadership extends beyond technical achievements. I head the Adevinta ML Guild, where I organize paper reading sessions and am actively working to bring a Ph.D. member on board to strengthen our team. This role allows me to foster a culture of continuous learning and innovation, which I’m truly passionate about.

Before Adevinta, I was a Senior Data Scientist and NLP Engineer at the French Supreme Court, where I developed language models and named entity recognition systems that automated the anonymization of judicial documents, increasing productivity by 45%. Collaborating with academia, public institutions, and the European Commission was a significant part of this role, underscoring my ability to integrate research with practical solutions.

I am also deeply committed to promoting diversity in tech. My role previous role as an ambassador for the Pivigo Data Science hub, Women in Healthcare and Data Science Paris meetup, my efforts in organizing events that connect academia and industry reflect this commitment.

Additionally, I contributed a chapter on ML model interpretability to Applied Data Science in Tourism and have shared my work at various international conferences.

I’m driven by the opportunity to build impactful AI models that solve real-world problems, foster a culture of continuous learning, and promote the responsible use of AI. Let’s connect to explore how we can drive innovation together and leverage the power of AI to achieve transformative results.
